intro: Jasione sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It produces violet-blue or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Jasione sessiliflora is often found in alpine and Mediterranean regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
